required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Subcutaneous MOA-728 for the Treatment of Opioid-Induced Constipation (OIC) in Subjects With Chronic Non-Malignant Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Mulitcenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study of Subcutaneous MOA-728 for the Treatment of Opioid-Induced Constipation in Subjects With Chronic Non-Malignant Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of the protocol is to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and tolerability of subcutaneous MOA-728 versus placebo in subjects with chronic non-malignant pain who have Opioid-Induced Constipation (OIC).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Having a Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of the First Dose
primary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Active Injections Resulting in Any Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of Injection During the Double-blind Period
primary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Active injections are those that contain study drug (e.g., daily injections in MOA-728 QD treatment group and every other injection for the MOA-728 QOD treatment group). The corresponding injections in the placebo group were used as controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to the First Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) After First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Responses following first injection were censored at 24 hours or at time of the second injection, which ever occurred first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Weekly Number of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) for the Double-blind Period at 4 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement defined as a bowel movement with no laxatives use during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were reported daily by patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The weekly number of RFBM was defined as the total number of RFBM reported during the double-blind period divided by the number of days the patient reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Number of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) (Open-label Period)
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The weekly number of RFBM was defined as the total number of RFBMs reported during study period divided by the number of days the patient reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number. Weekly number of RFBM determined as missing for <4 days of information.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving at Least 3 Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) Per Week in Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The weekly number of RFBM was defined as the total number of RFBM reported during the study week divided by the number of days the patient reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Active Injections Resulting in Any Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 1, 2, 3 and 6 Hour(s) in Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1-6 hours during 4 week double-blind period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Active injections are those that contain study drug (e.g., daily injections in MOA-728 QD treatment group and every other injection for the MOA-728 QOD treatment group). The corresponding injections in the placebo group were used as controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections Resulting in Any Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 Hours in Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With a Weekly Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Rate â‰¥ 3 and an Increase of at Least 1 in the Weekly RFBM Rate From Baseline for the Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The weekly RFBM rate was defined as the total number of RFBM reported during study period divided by the number of days the subject reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With an Increase of at Least 1 in the Weekly Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Rate From Baseline for the Double-blind Period at 4 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The weekly RFBM rate was defined as the total number of RFBM reported during study period divided by the number of days the subject reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Weekly Number of Bowel Movements During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The weekly number of BM was defined as the total number of BMs reported during study period divided by the number of days the subject reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Weekly Number of Quality Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
secondary_outcome.description: RFBM defined as bowel movement with no laxatives during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and assessments were reported daily by patient. Weekly number of quality RFBM was the total number of quality RFBM reported in study period divided by number of days with information and multiplied by 7 for a normalized weekly number. Stool quality assessed with the Bristol Stool Form Scale (7-points) (1=difficult to pass, 7=entirely liquid). A quality RFBM defined as one other than diarrhea (Bristol Type 1-5).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Weekly Number of Complete Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement defined as a bowel movement with no laxatives use during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were reported daily by patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Weekly number of complete RFBM was the total number of complete RFBM reported in study period divided by the number of days with information, and multiplied by 7 for a normalized weekly number. A complete RFBM has a sensation of complete evacuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bristol Stool Form Scale Score for Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Straining Scale Score of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) From Baseline During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The amount of straining associated with bowel movements was assessed using a 5-point straining scale, where 0=none and 4=very severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Bristol Stool Form Scale Score for Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) by 1 Point During Open Label Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Straining Scale Score for Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) by 1 Point During Open Label Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The amount of straining associated with bowel movements was assessed using a 5-point straining scale, where 0=none and 4=very severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) With Bristol Stool Form Scale in Type 3 or Type 4 From Baseline During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1=separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7=watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) Specifically, Type 3=like a sausage but with cracks on the surface, Type 4=Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) Classified as Diarrhea or Watery Stools From Baseline During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass), Type 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool, and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) This analysis included types 6 and 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Any Diarrhea or Watery Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) During Open-label Period.
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass), Type 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool, and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) This analysis included types 6 and 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) With Straining Scale Scores of 0 or 1 (no, or Mild) From Baseline During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The amount of straining associated with bowel movements was assessed using a 5-point straining scale, where 0=none, 1 = mild and 4=very severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) With a Sensation of Complete Evacuation From Baseline During Double-blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). A complete RFBM has a sensation of complete evacuation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult outpatients with opioid-induced constipation and chronic non-malignant pain.
- Taking oral, transdermal, intravenous, or subcutaneous opioids.
- Willingness to discontinue all pre-study laxative therapy and use only study permitted rescue laxatives.
Exclusion Criteria
- History of chronic constipation before the initiation of opioid therapy.
- Other GI disorders known to affect bowel transit.
- Women who are pregnant, breast-feeding, or plan to become pregnant.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited worldwide from August 2007 to September 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were screened up to 16 days.

group.title: MOA-728 QD (Double-blind)
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once daily (QD) for weeks 1 through 4

group.title: MOA-728 QOD (Double-blind)
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day, Placebo once daily on alternating days for weeks 1 through 4

group.title: MOA-728 QD (Double-blind)
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once daily (QD) for weeks 1 through 4

group.title: MOA-728 QOD (Double-blind)
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day, Placebo once daily on alternating days for weeks 1 through 4

measure.title: Age
measure.description: This baseline measure captures the double-blind population demographics in the arms MOA-728 QD, MOA-728 QOD and Placebo. It also captures the baseline demographics for the open-label portion of the study.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: This baseline measure captures the double-blind population demographics in the arms MOA-728 QD, MOA-728 QOD and Placebo. It also captures the baseline demographics for the open-label portion of the study

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Having a Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of the First Dose
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS).
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. For this analysis, the MOA-728 QD and MOA-728 QOD treatment groups were combined as the treatment regimen was the same through the first dose (day 1).

group.title: MOA-728 QD and MOA-728 QOD
group.description: MOA-728 QD treatment group (12 mg every day) and MOA-728 QOD treatment group (12 mg once every other day, with placebo once daily on alternating days).

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Having a Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of the First Dose
measure.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS).
measure.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. For this analysis, the MOA-728 QD and MOA-728 QOD treatment groups were combined as the treatment regimen was the same through the first dose (day 1).

outcome.title: Percentage of Active Injections Resulting in Any Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of Injection During the Double-blind Period
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Active injections are those that contain study drug (e.g., daily injections in MOA-728 QD treatment group and every other injection for the MOA-728 QOD treatment group). The corresponding injections in the placebo group were used as controls.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article.

group.title: MOA-728 QOD
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day (QOD), with placebo once daily on alternating days

group.title: Placebo QD (Only QOD Injections)
group.description: Placebo group using odd numbered injections corresponding to the active injections in the MOA-728 QOD group. The same placebo patients of 162 was used for each active drug group (QD and QOD).

measure.title: Percentage of Active Injections Resulting in Any Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) Within 4 Hours of Injection During the Double-blind Period

group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once daily (QD) and MOA-728 12 mg once every other day (QOD), Placebo once daily on alternating days

measure.title: Time to the First Rescue-free Bowel Movement (RFBM) After First Dose

Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Responses following first injection were censored at 24 hours or at time of the second injection, which ever occurred first.

measure.units: % of subjects achieving RFBM in 24 hours

analysis.method_desc: Log-rank test for comparisons of survival distributions

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Weekly Number of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) for the Double-blind Period at 4 Weeks
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement defined as a bowel movement with no laxatives use during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were reported daily by patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The weekly number of RFBM was defined as the total number of RFBM reported during the double-blind period divided by the number of days the patient reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF).

analysis.method_desc: Treatment as factor and baseline weekly RFBM as covariate

outcome.title: Weekly Number of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) (Open-label Period)
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The weekly number of RFBM was defined as the total number of RFBMs reported during study period divided by the number of days the patient reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number. Weekly number of RFBM determined as missing for <4 days of information.
outcome.population: Patients who continued into the open-label period and received at least 1 dose of test article. Observed case analysis.

group.title: MOA-728 PRN (Open-label)
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg as needed (PRN) during weeks 5 through 12

outcome.description: Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The weekly number of BM was defined as the total number of BMs reported during study period divided by the number of days the subject reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

group.title: MOA-728 QOD
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day (QOD), Placebo once daily on alternating days

measure.title: Change in Weekly Number of Bowel Movements During Double-blind Period
measure.description: Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The weekly number of BM was defined as the total number of BMs reported during study period divided by the number of days the subject reported diary information in that period, and then multiplied by 7 to normalize to a weekly number.
measure.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

analysis.method_desc: Treatment as factor, Baseline as covariate
Treatment as factor, Baseline as covariate

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Weekly Number of Quality Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
outcome.description: RFBM defined as bowel movement with no laxatives during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and assessments were reported daily by patient. Weekly number of quality RFBM was the total number of quality RFBM reported in study period divided by number of days with information and multiplied by 7 for a normalized weekly number. Stool quality assessed with the Bristol Stool Form Scale (7-points) (1=difficult to pass, 7=entirely liquid). A quality RFBM defined as one other than diarrhea (Bristol Type 1â€“5).
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

group.title: MOA-728 QOD

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Weekly Number of Quality Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
measure.description: RFBM defined as bowel movement with no laxatives during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and assessments were reported daily by patient. Weekly number of quality RFBM was the total number of quality RFBM reported in study period divided by number of days with information and multiplied by 7 for a normalized weekly number. Stool quality assessed with the Bristol Stool Form Scale (7-points) (1=difficult to pass, 7=entirely liquid). A quality RFBM defined as one other than diarrhea (Bristol Type 1â€“5).
measure.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

outcome.title: Change in Weekly Number of Complete Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM)
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement defined as a bowel movement with no laxatives use during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were reported daily by patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). Weekly number of complete RFBM was the total number of complete RFBM reported in study period divided by the number of days with information, and multiplied by 7 for a normalized weekly number. A complete RFBM has a sensation of complete evacuation.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.)

Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.)

outcome.title: Change in Straining Scale Score of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) From Baseline During Double-blind Period
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The amount of straining associated with bowel movements was assessed using a 5-point straining scale, where 0=none and 4=very severe.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). group.description: MOA-728 12 mg as needed (PRN) during weeks 5 through 12

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Straining Scale Score for Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) by 1 Point During Open Label Period
measure.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The amount of straining associated with bowel movements was assessed using a 5-point straining scale, where 0=none and 4=very severe.
measure.population: Patients who continued into the open-label period and received at least 1 dose of test article.

outcome.title: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) With Bristol Stool Form Scale in Type 3 or Type 4 From Baseline During Double-blind Period
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1=separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7=watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) Specifically, Type 3=like a sausage but with cracks on the surface, Type 4=Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

group.title: MOA-728 QOD
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day (QOD), Placebo once daily on alternating days

measure.title: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) With Bristol Stool Form Scale in Type 3 or Type 4 From Baseline During Double-blind Period
measure.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone IVRS. The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1=separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass) and Type 7=watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) Specifically, Type 3=like a sausage but with cracks on the surface, Type 4=Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft.
measure.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

analysis.method_desc: Treatment as factor, Baseline as covariate
Treatment as factor, Baseline as covariate

outcome.title: Change in Percentage of Rescue-free Bowel Movements (RFBM) Classified as Diarrhea or Watery Stools From Baseline During Double-blind Period
outcome.description: A rescue-free bowel movement was defined as a bowel movement where no laxatives were used during the prior 24 hours. Information on laxative use, bowel movements and bowel movement assessments were self reported daily by the patient using a telephone interactive voice response system (IVRS). The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass), Type 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool, and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) This analysis included types 6 and 7.
outcome.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

group.title: MOA-728 QOD
group.description: MOA-728 12 mg once every other day (QOD), Placebo once daily on alternating days

The Bristol Stool Form Scale assessed stool quality using a 7-point scale, where Type 1 = separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass), Type 6 = fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool, and Type 7 = watery, no solid pieces (entirely liquid.) This analysis included types 6 and 7.
measure.population: Patients who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blinded test article. Last observation carried forward (LOCF)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
